title: Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site: Park Home
body: The Road to Justice  The story of Brown v. Board of Education, which ended legal segregation in public schools, is one of hope and courage. When the people agreed to be plaintiffs in the case, they never knew they would change history. The people who make up this story were ordinary people. They were teachers, secretaries, welders, ministers and students who simply wanted to be treated equally. Read More             The story of Brown v. Board of Education   The U.S. Supreme Court decision in Brown v. Board of Education (1954) is one of the most pivotal opinions ever rendered by that body.             Topeka's Civil Rights Story   One hundred years of Kansas history separates John Brown's war on slavery and the U.S. Supreme Court's ruling in Brown v. Board of Education        Plan a Field Trip   Whether you have an hour or a day, there are multiple Field Trip options available.
